etymologies: early 16th century: from medieval Latin, from the given name Veronica. veronica (sense 2, are with reference to St Veronica (see Veronica, St.); sense 3 is said to be by association of the attitude of the matador with the depiction of St Veronica holding out a cloth to Christ

definitions: a herbaceous plant of north temperate regions, typically with upright stems bearing narrow pointed leaves and spikes of blue or purple flowers.

notes.text: Genus Veronica, family Scrophulariaceae: many species, including the speedwells

shortDefinitions: herbaceous plant of north temperate regions

definitions: a cloth supposedly impressed with an image of Jesus' face.
shortDefinitions: cloth supposedly impressed with image of Christ's face

definitions: (in bullfighting) a slow movement of the cape away from a charging bull by the matador, who stands in place.
shortDefinitions: movement of matador's cape away from charging bull
